reviews.review_msg: This class is so relevant and helpful for everyday life. Maureen is such a sweet lady who is funny and easy to listen to. There's homework every week but it's super light and takes less than an hour. Her tests are fair and not too difficult.

Easily the most boring, uninformative class I ever attended in 3 years at SFU mostly due to the teacher Tara Immell. She is highly not recommended.  Also included a $203.79 course fee??? my O chem lab fee was 9 dollars for comparison.

Canvas course is a mess

Assignment descriptions are long, poorly written and formatted. Reused from past terms with no effort to proof read.

Marking is vague +subjective

Class is scheduled for 3 hours but only teaches for 2

TA has no respect for class or Tara

Lectures are read off powerpoint
Has a habit of repeating "_is gonna go ahead and _"

BUS 221 is a fluf elective, very low stakes, so this review is possibly biased. Tara was extremely engaging, had a lot of experience on trading floors to draw from. Very kind and understanding, will connect with you on a human level and provide accomodations if you are struggling with things outside of class. 100% planning to take her other classes

She is a horrible professor. She wrote in her syllabus to not email her and ask questions during lecture time, she does not even provide her email. The TA is unresponsive and nothing has been graded in weeks. First lecture, she did not even know whether she uploaded her syllabus yet and her powerpoint did not work. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.

Tara is a very sweet professor, and helps you if you ask for help. She does her best to make the class engaging and teaches you the necessary stuff. If you listen to the lectures and participate, you'll do good in her class.

Took her strategic planning class and literally one of the most horrible professors ever. She doesn't even teach, put the PowerPoint slides she got from another professor on the projector and reads it all loud. Please don't ever choose her class unless you wanna waste your time and money.

The course is structured around the assignments and peer-review. Tara gives out an assignment and a draft needs to be completed and uploaded by end of week at which point other students critique your work. Then the final copy is due before midnight after the following class. She barely does any teaching herself and instructions are often unhelpful.

She is very nice and enthusiastic about what she is teaching but is also very unorganized and all over the place. We didn't have our course schedule finished until a couple of weeks into the semester. She would go on long tangents in class about her personal life, and the assignments/tests expected a level of knowledge we did not receive in class.

Other reviews basically sum it up. Tara's a sweet person but her organization is awful. She goes on tangents in lecture on what could've been a great learning experience on useful things. Also not a fan of how assignment deadlines are due days after or the day of her giving instructions. At least the assignments weren't difficult.

Tara is a very nice woman, but her lectures are not it. She would talk about the same things for 3 hours and then quiz us on things she didn't teach. Very vague and unclear instructions for each assignment. The TA was not good as well, did not have an approachable attitude and was an extremely hard marker when she actually marked assignments.

Tara is a nice prof, but her teaching is awful. She is overly enthusiastic in lectures, and rambles too much instead of actually teaching the concepts. Assignment descriptions and rubrics were vague. She expects students to have income and know financing beforehand. This class is a self effort and to students who are new to this, do not take!

Tara is very nice, but she does not teach. She will say the same things over for the couple-hour lectures. Always makes projects/assignments due on weekends, but gives very little notice/explanation during class before submission due date. You think you'd learn some good skills, but you do not, don't recommend this course with her.

I am a Deans List student, and this is the worst course I have ever taken in my academic career. Tara is disorganized and did not release the course syllabus for weeks, and would randomly create assignments outside of class time and expect students to finish it within hours. I am begging anyone who is reading this to not take this course.
Tara doesn't teach, if BUS 221 wasn't practically just Planning 10 from high school, everyone would've failed. Thank god this class was made of material that a 5th grader can solve.

Her teaching style made a really promising class with many life skills borderline useless. Rather than giving informative lectures, much class time is wasted examining canvas or answering assignment questions on what realistically should have been taught. She's nice as a person, but for the first time in 3 years at SFU, I learned nothing in a class

Tara's classes are spent almost entirely discussing due dates because she changes them constantly and majority of the class ends up confused. The syllabus is useless and her assignment outlines are very poorly described. The work in this class is very easy but the organization or lack thereof is headache inducing. Won't take a class with her again.

Tara has been making changes to the class since the beginning of the semester to accommodate everyone. Her class depends a lot on people having the motivation to be part of the activities. I like the content and I feel like this will be helpful to me in the future. She really cares about helping students learn about financial freedom. Easy class :)

Tara was a mess this semester. Instructions for assignments were unclear, she didn't respond to any emails, and lectures were completely pointless and disorganized. As of five weeks after the final project was due, we still don't have marks for over half of the work we did in the semester. This is despite having THREE TAs for a 40-student class.

I was so excited for this personal finance class. I think Tara is sweet and really tries to understand and accommodate. Online transition was difficult but only can be used as an excuse for so long. I loved Enriched Academy and learned lots. Assignments and one hour Q&A's were UNRELATED to the video. I was very disappointed. Unorganized.

What a waste of money and time. Tara during the summer semester was not very clear with her expectations and her communication was lacking. She would take FOREVER to respond to emails and believed in no communication is better for students. She claims that a workshop she attended for online learning believed in little communication with students.

Very dissatisfied with Tara's approach to online learning. I heard rave reviews about this class due to the practicality of the content. Tara's approach this summer was far from great. She failed in communication in which took over a month for response through email and was very unclear. Her grading scheme was nonexistent and marked inconsistent.

I Understand that Online teaching is hard, but this was the worst educational experience I've ever had, the worst professor ever, she would delete messages from discussion boards, avoid questions, lie about emails. Take this in perspective, we are a week into the fall semester and she still hasn't given us our grades for the summer semester.A KAREN

Avoid take her. Waste money and time. I felt sorry for the money that was given by taking her class and learned nothing. She sells videoes rather than taking the remoting classes by herself. Don't waste your money on this course. It's not worthy it.

No 3-hour lecture only 1-hour Q&A online. So lazy that didn't give us her email and TA's. She didn't follow the deadline of the syllabus, one of the quizzes posted online after the deadline of it. She won't receive students' suggestions and forced to close zoom to avoid listening to anyone who said any suggestion. No organization. Didn't teach any.

Professor Immell has failed to successfully transition a coherent Personal Finance course curriculum to the remote learning environment. The class was disorganized, her responses to emails were scarce, and her Office hours could barely be considered constructive. The class is all over the place, so much lack of structure. I would not recommend her.

I really enjoyed this class. You learn many useful things, and Tara seems kind and sweet. The quizzes and assignments were really easy, and there was no midterm/final this term. Tara had some technical issues, and I think it would've been better taking this course in-person. The workload is very light, and the math involved is super simple.

Little to no communication, took over a month to get in touch, the grading criteria was unclear. When students are unable to get into the zoom, she ignored it and said, "its working for the rest of us", then kept going. Said she would record the optional lectures, but didn't because she didn't have hard drive space, so we were left in the dark.

Not ever professors great, but it's not hard to be a decent human being. She needs to start taking credit for her faults, seems like she's always blaming others for her mistakes. She is a terrible prof, doesn't seem qualified to teach at all. She's also super aggressive. SFU seriously needs to step in and fix the issue for BUS 221. Tara is terrible
BRUH, she's legit the worst prof at SFU. So lazy, disgusting how she doesn't care about students. Such an airhead too, I can't believe SFU hired her as a prof.

The worst prof EVER! Doesn't communicate, no expectations, doesn't follow her own rubric, and so on. She literally is the laziest person I have ever met and doesn't care AT ALL about her students. We wait MONTHS for a response through email and the TAs have no clue what is going on either.

Tara is such a great prof who makes classes fun and interesting. I was never bored in her class. She does a lot of group in-class practice to prepare for exams and even had us writing practice questions on the windows and white boards! She is very kind and cares for her students. BUS221 with Tara was my favourite class at SFU! so practical!

Tara is very kind, and is more than happy to answer questions during our outside of class time. she keep grading criteria clear and concise. She takes material that some may find difficult, and she goes through it at such a pace that anyone can keep up.
Very nice prof with good knowledge behind. I would definitely take classes with her again.

Very disorganized prof! I honestly don't know why I am paying so much to learn the things that I can simply go online and learn it myself. She was late for the second midterm and said it was a school wide printer shut down. So my question is, aren't you supposed to be prepare before then? The grading is flexible tho that's all I can say about it.

Tara was a very nice professor, the class is far more approachable than most other business courses. The final is harder than expected, but if you need a grade booster or want a simpler quantitative elective, take BUS 221 with Tara

Tara is a super nice professor, and the class is very useful. However, the marking scheme was somewhat unclear and the final was way tougher than any practice problems/questions/scenarios. Looking back, a hard final to study for.
useful class, but Tara isn't clear on whats for marks and what isn't. Final was way harder than anything that was discussed in class.
Tara was an amazing prof for BUS 221. She is the most caring and understanding prof. She provides a ton of resources, TA office hours and online help during midterm/finals week.

Amazing professor, cares for the class makes sure everyone has all the help and resources they need. Very thorough with lectures. Explains what will be expected on tests. Overall one of the best professors I have ever had.
